data: It is a protein that is a type of 'tumor marker.'
Tumor markers are substances that are often made by cancer cells or by normal cells in response to cancer.
High levels of CEA are normal in healthy, unborn babies.
After birth, CEA levels become very low or disappear completely.
So, healthy adults should have little or no CEA in their bodies.
A high CEA level in a person recently treated for certain cancers may mean the cancer has returned.
A higher than normal level may be due to the following cancers: Breast cancer; Colon cancer; Lung cancer; Pancreatic cancer; Thyroid cancer
